org.forgerock.openam.session.authorisation

Class SessionChangeAuthorizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.session.authorisation.SessionChangeAuthorizer

  • @Singleton
public class SessionChangeAuthorizer
extends Object
    Session Change Authorizer acts as a mini authorisation manager for changes to a session that need to be permission checked.

      • checkPermissionToDestroySession

        public void checkPermissionToDestroySession(Session requester,
                                            SessionID sessionId)
                                     throws SessionException
        Checks if the requester has the necessary permission to destroy the provided session. The user has the necessary privileges if one of these conditions is fulfilled:
        • The requester attempts to destroy its own session.
        • The requester has top level admin role (having read/write access to any service configuration in the top level realm).
        • The session's client domain is listed in the requester's profile under the iplanet-am-session-destroy-sessions service service attribute.
        Parameters:
        requester - The requester's session.
        sessionId - The session to destroy.
        Throws:
        SessionException - If none of the conditions above is fulfilled, i.e. when the requester does not have the necessary permissions to destroy the session.

      • hasPermissionToDestroySession

        public boolean hasPermissionToDestroySession(Session requester,
                                             SessionID sessionId)
                                      throws SessionException
        Checks if the requester has the necessary permission to destroy the provided session. The user has the necessary privileges if one of these conditions is fulfilled:
        • The requester attempts to destroy its own session.
        • The requester has top level admin role (having read/write access to any service configuration in the top level realm).
        • The session's client domain is listed in the requester's profile under the iplanet-am-session-destroy-sessions service service attribute.
        Parameters:
        requester - The requester's session.
        sessionId - The session to destroy.
        Throws:
        SessionException - If none of the conditions above is fulfilled, i.e. when the requester does not have the necessary permissions to destroy the session.
